• Blog

Site-seeing made easy

When you make a new feature branch, Probo sets up a copy of your site for you to preview. You can test your changes, see what things look like, and — when you're happy — merge in the changes. Probo keeps the environments around as long as you like, letting your developers, QA testers, project managers, and clients see your work in progress, review your work, or do final User Acceptance Testing.

1

Create a pull request from your branch

2

When your tests finish, see your results

3

Verify the site still looks good with your own two eyes

Github and Stash Integration

We live in pull requests and our bet is you do too. Probo creates an environment for each pull request, and gives you links to the site and test results within the pull request.

Configured with YAML

A simple .Probo.yml yaml file in your repository tells Probo how to set up your site and run your tests.

Optimized for Database-driven Apps

Using your sanitized database backups, each Probo environment has your site's latest content and configuration. No more coordinating with the entire team to schedule a database sync from production to testing environments.
